sections.content: AI upscaling uses deep learning models trained on millions of image pairs to intelligently predict and generate missing pixel information when increasing image resolution.

faq.question: What's the difference between AI upscaling and traditional interpolation?
faq.answer: Traditional interpolation (bilinear, bicubic) simply averages nearby pixels, creating blurry results. AI upscaling uses learned patterns to generate realistic, sharp detAIls.

faq.question: Can AI upscaling create new information?
faq.answer: AI upscaling generates plausible pixel information based on learned patterns from trAIning data. It creates what's likely to be there, not necessarily what was originally there.

faq.question: How do I choose the right upscaling factor?
faq.answer: Consider your intended use case. 2x is good for moderate improvement, 4x for significant enhancement, and 8x for dramatic upscaling when quality is less critical.

faq.answer: You can increase pixel dimensions, but you can't add new detAIl. AI upscaling can help, but starting with adequate is always .

faq.question: Which algorithm should I use for general photography?
faq.answer: Bicubic for most cases, Lanczos for critical applications. Consider AI upscaling for significant enlargement needs.

faq.question: Why do different scaling algorithms produce different results?
faq.answer: They use different mathematical approaches to predict pixel values. Some prioritize speed, others prioritize accuracy or specific visual characteristics.

faq.question: Is AI upscaling always better than traditional methods?
faq.answer: AI methods excel at significant upscaling but may be overkill for minor adjustments. They're also slower and more resource-intensive.
